meanings.definition: A vine on which grapes grow.
meanings.sent1: The grapevine in our backyard produces sweet grapes every summer.
meanings.sent2: The farmer carefully tended to the grapevine to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the grapevine as a swing, much to the surprise of the grapes.
meanings.sent4: The grapevine twisted and turned, like a dancer gracefully moving in the wind.
meanings.sent5: Clusters of grapes hung from the grapevine, like jewels adorning a green necklace.

meanings.definition: A method of spreading information through gossip or rumor.
meanings.sent1: The grapevine at school quickly spread news about the upcoming dance.
meanings.sent2: She heard the latest gossip through the grapevine at work.
meanings.sent3: The grapevine whispered secrets that made everyone giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Information traveled through the grapevine like a wildfire, reaching every corner of the town.
meanings.sent5: The grapevine buzzed with excitement, carrying tales from one ear to another.
